symposium.model

Class Constraint

  • java.lang.Object
    • symposium.model.Constraint
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConsecutivePanelsConstraint, Filter, MaxPanelistConstraint, NoOverlapConstraint, PairedPanelistConstraint, SizeConstraint, TimeConstraint

    public abstract class Constraint
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Constraints is an abstract class and the main parent for all constraint classes. Each Constraint has a given priority (enum), which determines if a constraint is REQUIRED, VERY_IMPORTANT, or DESIRED. Each child of the Constraint class will be testing if the constraint is violated or not. Please refer to each constraint class for their documentation.

    • Method Detail

      • checkViolationCache

        public boolean checkViolationCache(VenueTime venueTime)
        Dependencies: isConstraintViolated method, VenueTime class The method checks the cache for each VenueTime and returns the violation If the cache is empty populate it with the violation through isConstraintViolated()
        Parameters:
        venueTime - The time being checked
        Returns:
        boolean; The violation value for the venueTime. True if constraint is violated at prospective venueTime, false otherwise.

      • checkViolationCache

        public boolean checkViolationCache()
        Dependencies: isConstraintViolated method, VenueTime class The method checks the cache for each VenueTime and returns the violation If the cache is empty populate it with the violation through isConstraintViolated()
        Returns:
        boolean; The violation value for the venueTime. True if constraint is violated at prospective venueTime, false otherwise.

      • isConstraintViolated

        public abstract boolean isConstraintViolated(VenueTime venueTime)
        Dependencies: VenueTime class Method to be implemented in the child classes. Depending on the constraint this method implementation will change. The general idea is to test if the constraint is violated or not
        Parameters:
        venueTime - The time being checked
        Returns:
        boolean; If the constraint is violated returns true, otherwise, returns false.

      • isConstraintViolated

        public boolean isConstraintViolated()
        Dependencies: VenueTime class Similar to isConstraintViolated it tests a specific panel constraint. The method test the comparison of the venueTime for the given panel with all the other panels scheduled at that time.
        Returns:
        boolean; If the constraint is violated returns true, otherwise, returns false.

      • removeCachedValue

        public void removeCachedValue(VenueTime venueTime)
        Removes the cached bool for the specified venueTime.
        Parameters:
        venueTime - The time being checked

      • clearCache

        public void clearCache()
        Clears the entire cache, starts anew cache.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        The toString method will differ for each constraint. The method specifies what is meant when a constraint is violated Each constraint will return the message associated with it when it is violated.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String message of the violation.
